text: is the drag n drop having issues for anyone else? It will not allow me to drag the modules I need to move and just shows a stuck module on the screen instead
yea that happens every now and again. only solution to fix I’ve found is refresh
I've refreshed a ton of times :confused:
thanks though...I'll try a new tab and see if that helps
new tab did the trick...thanks <@U7SL518D6>
I've had to go into the modules, click the link under the module name where it shows what kind of pages types its for, then click update
it's wonky
yeah I usually just get frustrated and go back to the v1 but I'm trying to be a better person...

come to the dark side Mvlillalobos we have repeater fields
_and shameless plug - if you use the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>, we also have a dark theme for the dark side._ <https://spin.d.pr/9uWxei+>
I've been seeing this a LOT lately!
anyone having cache issues specifically for blog templates. <@U26B530N6>

<@UBZ8C6DTK> does adding a query param to the URL notgive you the latest version of the page?

HS’s cache can take like 20 minutes to clear for css and JS changes using a param lets you force HS to show you the latest version because it treats every URL as a unique cachable page.
<@U7SL518D6> it's been over 10 mins that changes won't take effect, then goes back at it again. Its really annoying!!

it is - that’s why a few of us made an extension to make the query param trick faster/easier to do on the fly.
<https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/HubSpot-developer-extensi/gebemkdecnlgbcanplbgdpcffpdnfdfo>

Basically the trick is to keep incrementing a number or letters in a query paremeter each time you want to see a fresh copy of the page. Blogs tend to be particularly sticky
The extension does this for you by just making that a button push(no need to type in url)
do you mean to use "BustCache"
Yes, the bust cache button will append a parameter with a random string to it
fave feature of the dev plugin… the developer menu..

not so fun fact- the toggle to enable/disable a module from being addable to a template doesn’t appear to be working (I have a module with it disabled, so it should not be usable, but it can still be added)
Did you publish the module after you disabled it? If so can you please provide a link so I can take a look?
